Reviews.Title: “Not 5 stars but impressive makeover, fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: BLBTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a business conference for 4 nights. The hotel is in an ideal location to all downtown attractions. Literally within walking distance of everything you would need or want to see. I was impressed at the modern decor and attractiveness of the lobby and bar. I was also impressed by the room. It had great window with a view of downtown, super comfy beds, a large armoire and roomy dressing area and the room was very tastefully decorated. The room was also quite clean. I found the staff to be always incredibly friendly and helpful, so much so that it really stood out for the service alone. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and it was perfect for my business trip. There are only a few negative things about my experience: that there were a few minor details that needed tweaked in the room such as a small area of peeling wallpaper, recent repair that was not yet painted on the ceiling. (honestly though the rest of the room was so clean and nice it didn't bother me) The elevator is old and during one break in the conference when it was enduring a lot of use, it just quit and we all had to use the stairs. I ordered room service 3 times for convenience and it not only took a long time to get my food but the food was alway just mediocre. There was no refrigerator in the room, a small one to keep drinks cold would have been a nice touch. All in all, this is a nice hotel with great service, comfy rooms, great decor and a location that cannot be beat. This place is perfect for business. I would skip eating at the hotel though (at least room service). There are some fantastic places within walking distance or a short cab ride for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable place to stay, especially for business.”
Reviews.Author: GermFreak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here years ago when it was a Wyndham. (That time I got stuck in the elevator. More about that later.) I attended a conference here the past three days which was in this hotel so it was the place to stay. We attended a very large conference with hundreds of attendees. Pros: Great valets and bell hops. In fact, the staff would be the best part of the stay. I could not go on enough about the young men who worked here. They were simply wonderful. We interacted with many different gentlemen and they were all very professional. Also, the front desk staff were helpful. The room was not ready when we arrived early but they held our luggage and called me when it was which allowed us to go to dinner. The rooms were pretty clean, which is my #1 requirement. Great blinds to block out light. The location is really good, too. We were in the perfect location to visit the Heard Museum, Scottsdale, and the Desert Botanical Gardens. Cons: The escalators were not working going down. You cannot take an elevator down from the ballrooms to the Lobby. You must go the the bottom floor and walk outside. This was not a problem for most of us but it was for some. I do not know how someone who is physically handicap would attend without a great deal of assistance. The gift shop has very high prices, which I think most of us expect. Go to the store before coming here. The worst thing was that things are not well marked or explained. Do they serve breakfast? When? Is there a restaurant? Where is the pool? Why is there no phone book? The hotel channel did not work. Also, the walls really are pretty thin. You can hear slamming doors, etc. No refrigerator or microwave. Valet parking $23 and no free internet. Even if you get a good rate you are going to be paying full price soon enough. Back to the elevators - Did I get stuck? No. Did all the elevators go down? Yes. MANY people could not get to or from their rooms. One lady walked up 15 flights to get to her room. Not me. I asked about the service elevators and soon the staff was taking us on those to get us to our rooms, though it took about 15 to 20 minutes for this to occur. I think the elevators in this building need work since I know that the problems have been going on for years. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Biz trip”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and 3 days. Wonderful service, clean room, nice fitness center. Great location near light rail and only 10 minutes by cab to the airport. Fairly inexpensive at $129 per night. Definitely stay again when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: mytinc
Reviews.Content: I was attending a convention at the Phoenix Convention Center and this hotel was only a block away - great for walking in the beautiful Phoenix weather. Within walking distance were several restaurants (from fast food & starbucks to high end restaturants), which was nice as I didn't have a rental car. The room was nice and clean and hte bed was comfortable. My view overlooked the 5th floor balcony as well as a run down building across the street. Not much to look at, but I wasn't looking for views. The fitness room was well stocked with plenty of equipment that was all in working order with the exception of a few of the treadmill TVs. Overall a great and comfortable place to stay on business.

Reviews.Title: “Yo-yo”
Reviews.Author: timeflies4fun
Reviews.Content: This beautifully renovated Marriott property is still in the process of new management transition. Although we had several strong challenges for a smooth stay, it is the extremely cheerful, helpful,"we'll make it right" attitude of several key people on property. PJ, a bellman, went above and beyond throughout our stay. His personal greeting with our comings and goings, and immediate response with requests was impressive. Executive management take turns walking the lobby to make sure guests needs are bring met. One of them, Marty, an executive assistant, turned what could have been something miserable into delightful. And the long tern property lobby bartender,sorry I can't recall her name, just her smile, made you feel everything is good. I don't usually write reviews but I am so appreciate that clear effort and focus is in place to make this a preferred property. I would definitely stay again and look forward to visiting my new Renaissance friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not impressed with the room”
Reviews.Author: melorohrer
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay downtown so we could walk to Chase Field. The hotel was ideal for this. The parking is expensive $23 and $12.99 to use the internet. The room was small but upscale. I stayed at the Courtyard the next night and was more impressed with it than the Renaissance. Half the price and free internet, parking and breakfast. They have spent all of their money on the lobby of the Renaissance instead of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: We experienced a major challenge when we purchased our reservation online and it was lost in the system. We spent many hours of frustration trying to confirm our reservations when Alexander Turley, took us on and secured our rooms which ended up being much nicer rooms! Thank you Alex! We will be back. Cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Should be better Soon”
Reviews.Author: acoulter
Reviews.Content: Service excellent, decor and ambience are pleasant, breakfast is generous, fitness room average and good. Concierge Room is dreadful by Marriott standards. I'll return when the Concierge room has breakfast and wine/snacks in the evening. Until then, stay @airport Marriott -very good place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent interior design and location”
Reviews.Author: mkenneth
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip and managed to get one the reduced rates which was almost 60% off rack rate. The normal rate I believe is a pricey even given the fabulous location near everything and the hotel itself. Inside the hotel the checkin service, while very busy was efficient and polite. They have a great service there in the style of a concierge called the "navigator" who was a wealth of knowledge about what to do, see and eat. We did not dine in the hotel, so cannot comment on the food, however the bar area was well stocked and good service. I had a room on the 18th floor and it was very well laid out with great furnishings and high quality evident everywhere. I would definitely go back to this hotel if I could replicate the room rate I found!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.....”
Reviews.Author: lonlon97
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 9 pm on a Friday night. The check in process was smooth and everyone was very friendly. The hotel is downtown Phoenix but $23 for parking is a bit expensive. When we asked for advice regarding alternate parking options nobody was able to provide suggestions(very convenient). The room at first glance was beautiful but being a newer hotel I was suprised to see as many signs of wear and tear. We were lucky enough to get a room on the 5th floor so had access to a balcony area for smoking which was great because the hotel only has non smoking rooms so I thought we'd have to make a trek to the lobby each time. I will say that I think they cut costs with the beds. The bed was not very plush which was the biggest diappointment. Overall, the hotel was nice enough. I would stay there again if needed

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Rennaissance.”
Reviews.Author: micahlh
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks great and the staff is friendly but this hotel needs a lot of improvements. The valet service is slow and you can't self park. You can't get espresso at the coffee bar. The rooms could be cleaner (black stuff around inside of toilet). The walls are thin and noise from hall and surrounding rooms is easily heard. The staff are very friendly but can't make up for the average accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: TLL07
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here for business meetings. I'm a Marriott Platinum which they acknowledged when I checked in and told me they gave me a nice room. Later I found out that 2 of my colleagues who are Silvers in the program were upgraded to suites and sent notes from the manager saying how thrilled they were to have them staying. I received neither an upgrade nor a note so I guess my high degree of loyalty to Marriott doesn't matter at this hotel! The room was nice and beds were comfy but the A/C didn't work. It took them an hour to fix it and then they left plaster and who knows what else all over my carpet so I had to call down again to ask for someone to vacuum. The front desk staff was only mildly helpful but the staff supporting our meeting were very nice. Lobby was beautiful but as others have said there are obvious areas they haven't addressed in the renovation. I said Hail Mary's every time I got in the elevator as it frequently stopped a couple inches above or below the floor and I felt it was only a matter of time before I got stuck. The concierge lounge is very limited although the free breakfast they offered instead was quite nice. The gym is in serious need of an overhaul. Several of the machines were broken completely or partially. My team has frequent meetings in Phoenix but I don't believe we'll use this hotel again. It's too much of a mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on business and enjoyed the stay quite extensively. Parking is a nightmare whether you try to park on the street or pay exorbitant parking fees, but the hotel itself was a great experience all around. The room was very comfortable and all the amenities were exactly what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a Wyndham, off to a good start as a Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Dorkus
Reviews.Content: This place used to be a Wyndham Hotel IIRC, and is now a Renaissance. So far, so good. Nice location, close to offices, civic center, sports complexes, etc., with a reasonable amount of bars and restaurants close by. Also adjacent to the light rail system, which offers a convenient connection to a bus that takes you to Sky Harbor. Check in was fast and painless, and the room was standard Renaissance (that's a good thing). A solid option if downtown Phoenix is your destination.

Reviews.Title: “Travel with family”
Reviews.Author: 2010yvr
Reviews.Content: We required 2 nights accomodation in Phoenix during a very busy time.Unable to get something in Goodyear we opted to stay downtown.We wre able to get a room at the Renaissance.The staff at check in were extremely welcoming and accomodating.Seeing we had 5 in our family they gave us a large corner suite that turned out to be just fantastic.Beds were comfortable,coffee maker in the room was very good.Fridge was usefull .Pool and work out facilities were excellent.For the price you will not go wrong staying here.Walking distance to many interesting venues and light rail right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: dianaholbert
Reviews.Content: Pretty rooms, delicious breakfast, and absolutely loony service some of the time, but I'd still stand by my "excellent" raiting. I love that the windows open!

Reviews.Title: “So close...yet so far.”
Reviews.Author: Shavon B
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through Priceline and got a great rate, but the hotel was billed as at 3.5 star. I'm not sure I'd give it that extra half. The lobby is gorgeous, and it puts on a very pretty face. Unfortunately, if you scratch a little below the surface you find some not so great things. Overall, this was a good hotel, but my expectations at the time of booking were not met. I had requested a King room when booking, and even checked in the day before to confirm and ask for early check in at noon. When I arrived, I was told that I was booked into a 2 Queen room and that they didn't have a king room clean. I asked how long it would be, and that woman at the desk said it should be just a while longer..after noon. I had 30 minutes, so I asked her if I could wait in the bar and have a drink, then check in at noon. She said yes. But I sat in the bar for a full 10 minutes before realizing that it was not open/not staffed, and that was not going to change at that hour in the day. It would have been great to be told. I checked back in at 12:45 to learn that there was still not at king room available. Tired and wanting to just have a place to relax, I took the 2 Queen room. It was clean and had everything you could want, but was dark, and felt small and overcrowded. The paint was chipping on my bathroom door and the toilet paper holder was loose in the wall. There was a lovely cabinet in the vanity room for me to hand my clothes, but the space was not large enough to accommodate myself, the cabinet and my suitcase all at one time. The service was spotty. My room was cleaned daily, and my used towels taken away..but no new towels were left. I was there for 3 days, and my towels were never replenished. The pool was completely in the shade 24/7, so really wasn't of any use at all. The elevators were so obviously old that I was a little scared every time I stepped into one. The walls were thin, and I was woken every morning by other guests in the hall leaving for daily activities. I just felt that the hotel misrepresented itself, and had I had realistic expectations, I would not have been so disappointed. It was just very much an old hotel with a little spit polish. The saving grace to this trip was the evening Navigator (Renaissance Concierge) whose name was Ivy. He was FANTASTIC!!!! He found me a great trip to the Grand Canyon, calling two companies to find me space. He advised me on how to get out to Scottsdale the following day for a Giants spring training game, and when I could not reach my cab to return, he called around to find me a taxi at an affordable rate to get back. Not an easy task on St. Patrick's day! I cannot say enough good things about him. I wish I could review him and give him 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Generally very good hotel (except room 1134)”
Reviews.Author: pemahy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but between my room (1134) and next room are door in the wall so I hear every signle word from other room. I do not reccommed this room, but hotel is generally very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed at this hotel for a just under a week to see some spring training games and this was a great hotel! I am an elite member with Marriott so I can say that I have stay at many hotels and this is one of my favorites. Aside from the beautiful lobby and awesome room decor, the staff was great. The room was clean, comfortable, and newly renovated. There are two reasons why I decided to write this review. One was because I really thought it was neat to learn that a concept that the hotel follows is "to find something wonderfully new". As I was there my friend and I really discovered some great hole in the wall kind of places thanks to the staff. Thomas the bellman was great at giving us directions and advice on some great local places, and not to mention was always seemed to be there and greeted me and my friends every time I went downstairs. And the second reason was to talk about the manager Robbie who was great. I had a small issue while staying there and he not only corrected the issue but also made me feel better then before I even got upset. The professionalism and friendliness of everyone was great. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “trendy, nice hotel. friendly and helpful staff make up for problem-filled stay”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMiz
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the design and trendiness of the Renaissance. The atmosphere was lively and the hotel was nice. The rooms were big with huge bathrooms. However I had a few more than few problems that I would not expect when staying at a Marriott. If it wasn't for outstanding customer service I would have rated this stay a 2. The following things led to a poor experience: No hot water one morning. Three days (of seven) my room wasn't cleaned - around 4 or 5 PM I called to inquire and they were very responsivenss to sending housekeeping, but I'm not sure why it wasn't done. Bar service is very slow - the bartenders were nice however you often had to wait a long time for drinks/food. It wasn't really their fault, they were understaffed and it showed during busy times and happy hour. Valet - HUGE problem. Took at least 15-20 minutes to get my car, on one occasion they 'accidently' parked me in behind a bunch of cars parked for an event and I had to wait almost 45 minutes. The concierge lounge was subpar and needs improvement. In saying all of this, my stay was turned around by great customer service. I called management to speak about the problems and Andrea was terrific. She listened to my concerns, apologized, and followed up so things could be improved. The experience had not met my expectations of staying at a Marriott, however Andrea restored my trust in Marriott's commitment to great customer service. Additionally, Amanda at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. The concierage was a bit rude when I inquired about something, but I spoke with Amanda and she was able to provide a much better solution. She was cheerful and always willing to help. Hotel staff often make or break your experience, and Amanda's great attitude and friendliness along with Andrea's handling of problems are the reasons that this stay was turned into a positive one. I would happily choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious, clean, and hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJMCL
Reviews.Content: From the Aveda products in the bathroom to the cool decor in the rooms and lobby, this is a good hotel. It is nicely located next to the light rail system for easy to and from the airport. The hotel was clean, the sheets were soft and crisp white. The desk in the hotel was a perfect place to get work done. Lighting and in-room temp controls worked perfectly. No smells of any kind. The music in the lobby is upbeat and the candles throughout the lobby provide a nice mood for conversation in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JEB44
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Phoenix for the first time this March to visit the Grand Canyon and spring training. The Renaissance has a great location -- about 20 minutes to all the ball parks we wanted to visit. We were able to walk to numerous restaurants and businesses for breakfast and dinner. Everyone on staff was very helpful and accommodating during our trip. Marie, at the front desk, remembered who we were and was extremely helpful during our whole trip. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, and I would highly recommend others to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Brutus0160785
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Phoenix was great. Every employee was exceptionally nice and helpful. It is ideally located near Chase Field and the US Airways Center with great dining locations all within walking distance. Our stay could not have been better. I would highly recommend the Renaissance Phoenix to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jwk222
Reviews.Content: I am Platinum Elite with Marriott and travel throughout the country for business, spending the majority of my time on the road at other Marriotts. I have also been to downtown Phoenix in the past and found the hotels and restaurants in the area subpar. I recently stayed at the Renaissance during a business trip and was very pleasantly surprised with the quality of this hotel. While there are still updates needed to the corridors; the lobby, the rooms, and the food/bar are great. Also the staff's service and friendliness far exceeded expectations. I will choose this hotel again in the future and look forward to returning this spring for baseball. With the Renaissance, I will definitely choose to stay downtown instead of in Scottsdale when I'm here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and that is about it”
Reviews.Author: Sector18
Reviews.Content: The location is great and when you walk in you get the feeling this is very high end hotel. But inside things were very disorganized and chaotic. I don't think they have doormen any more because I never talked to one the three nights I stayed there. Also the check in process was hard to figure out because there are three different entrances. It turns out I was in the wrong queue because there weren't any markers or signs telling me where to stand. In between all this, the drunk businessmen at the bar were making such a racket that it would have been hard to understand what anyone was saying... if anyone bothered to try to help me, that is. After surviving the checkin, I was really surprised how weak the facilities were inside the room. First, it was kind of small. I had to move furniture before I could open the ironing board all the way. If I was thirsty after waiting through the check-in queues, I would have to come up with $5 to enjoy the bottle of water they kindly placed in the room for me. The coffee machine was a single cup format. And the cups were foam. The linens didn't completely cover the mattress so the corners popped open during the night. The internet comes at over $10. Painful! This is the year 2012, not 1998 so there is no excuse for charging sky high prices when even a cheap motel can figure out how to offer high-speed internet for free. And of course, you don't want to accidentally order room service at $4.50 per bagel. But at least they offer you a foam cup of nice quality tea downstairs in the lobby. Enjoy that until you can figure out how to find food in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Downtown is an outstanding hotel. The staff were all very helpful and accomidating. I can't even express how pleased I was with the service from the front desk, to the consierge, to the valets. We were in town to watch spring training in the MLB's Cactus League. All of the stadiums that we attended were within 30 minutes of the hotel. We were able to cool off from the Arizona sun in the rooftop pool. Very Nice. For dinner we were able to walk to many restaurants in the downtown area. I would definately stay at the Renaissance again, should I make another trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Front Desk, Worst hotel shower ever.”
Reviews.Author: corey_sebes
Reviews.Content: To start with, this is a pretty average Renaissance. Similar to most of the others I've stayed at. One thing that did stick out was how awesome the Front Desk was. We were going to a Suns game and needed to print our tickets. Amanda at the Front Desk really helped us out, and she was able to print them off for us at no cost (the concierge wanted us to pay $7 for 2 pieces of paper...). Two things that were really disappointing about my stay: - The valet service was pretty horrible. In the morning, I would call 15 minutes before I wanted my car (they recommend 10) and my keys would still be hanging on the board when I went downstairs to fetch my car. I also had brought my car back and told them to keep it out since I was leaving again in 10 minutes. I went downstairs, and it was back in the garage. Luckily the restaurant held my reservation. - The shower was also horrible. Most renaissances have the waterfall shower heads, and this one had one from the 80s. There was usually no water pressure when I showered at 5am, and the water was cold every morning except my last one there. I had to wash my hair in the sink multiple times. I didn't have a choice of my hotel, but I would probably stay at a Marriott instead just so I know the consistency is there. The Front Desk was OUTSTANDING through and so were the people I talked to in DTS.

Reviews.Title: “Average In Most Ways”
Reviews.Author: winwolf56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated in downtown Phoenix for the convention center (just a few short blocks), sports facilities or downtown office towers. It is a quick 15 minute or less cab ride (or Light Rail ride) to PHX. Note that downtown Phoenix is one of those places where the sidewalks are rolled up after dark unless there is an event on at the arena or ball park. While the area feels safe after dark, be prepared for a lot of empty store fronts. The hotel and rooms have been renovated reletively recently, but it is hard to mask that this is an aging hotel in a struggling downtown. LInenes were on the cheap side and room amenities inferior to other Renaissance Hotels I have been in previoulsy. Staff are very pleasant and made me feel welcome. Would not stay here again unless I specifically had to be in downtown Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good...service even better”
Reviews.Author: Jeff7711
Reviews.Content: Being greeted by Floyd at the front desk set the tone for a great stay. After meeting him once, he always remembered our names and greeted us with a smile. He's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Kmsmith803
Reviews.Content: Stay was good rooms were in good condition. Service was good. This was my first time to Phoenix to visit my children and Geoff gave me great directions and places to eat. He made me feel right at home and comfortable. Phoenix is a great city and I will definitely be back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Phoenix hands down!!”
Reviews.Author: Terrymiller19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the renaissance over Christmas for business and man oh man it was the best hotel I've ever been to. When I got there the first thing I noticed was the beautiful lobby and great atmosphere. Marble floors, spacious, trendy, and very comfortable. The rooms were also very good. They have been newly renovated and the beds are great!!!! They have a really cool bar area called ICON in the lobby which has great appetizers. Overall the hotel is great and if you are going to stay downtown this is by far the best hotel but I think the thing that made this hotel just that much better was the awesome staff. They were friendly, clean cut, fun, and professional. Amanda at the front desk is very sweet and was helpful at answering many of my questions and still was fast and efficient at check in. I also worked with two bellman on my trip. Thomas and Floyd. Thomas brought my things up to my room and was not only friendly but extremely informative about the room and before I even had to ask if he would get me ice he already had the ice bucket in hand and offered to get some for me ad Floyd saved me from being late to the airport on my checkout. I was running late and he made sure to have a car ready and waiting trunk open and all, the second I walked out the door. Great customer service!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy rooms, great location, fun bar”
Reviews.Author: KJohnson6969
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. Great location right downtown, fabulous and friendly staff, and very sharp and comfortable rooms. The valet parking is a plus and the bar is a fun place to hang out and meet friends. Great experience and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Service Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Parity
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great and they have made a major update. Upon checking in during a conference, they only had unrenovated rooms left, which would have been an upset except that the staff handled it extremely well and quickly provided acceptable concessions. The security/shipping staff also did an amazing job of handling a package that was accidentally shipped to the hotel after we left. They arranged to ensure it was shipped back to the shipper without any hassle, which was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Had many great experiences here!”
Reviews.Author: azwestmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great bar, the Icon, with a urban yet comfortable atmosphere, and the service is terrific. The food is great in the restaurant, but what I have really noticed is that when they are catering a large event, and serve a sit down dinner to hundreds, they do it quickly and efficiently and the food is always delicious and is always presented so nicely. I can honestly say I have never had a bad meal there. They always seem prepared for the event, and always have enough staff to take care of last minute requests. It is a beautiful hotel and the employees really seem to care about their customers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience with events”
Reviews.Author: BreezyBB
Reviews.Content: Working for a non-profit, I have used the Renaissance (formally Wyndham) for events for years and love them. I mainly work with Michael in planning the event and honestly ALWAYS have a great experience with him. He works hard to give me a competitive price and the customer experience, meals and events always are wonderful. So wonderful, my best friend had a wedding in 2010 on the terrace and it was amazing. Always pleased and I know to just come here first when planning my events.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome convention location!”
Reviews.Author: BethS623
Reviews.Content: Our state organization had its annual convention here and we were blown away by the professionalism, the elegance, and the very workable space that we needed for our sessions and breakouts. The rooms were affordable and very nice. The staff treated us like queens! But the best part of all was our catering manager, Michael Petersen-Incorvaia, who treated us like family. No request was too big or small. He made us feel at home, provided us with much needed insight and guidance, and never once got annoyed with our crazy changes in food, set up, or needs. Michael Petersen-Incorvaia is the crowning jewel in the catering/convention department!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPaladin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel because my business was exhibiting at a trade show at the nearby convention center. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the room was attractive, clean and comfortable, with a comfy chair and a nice TV. A fridge would be a welcome addition to the room. This location was excellent, and the price was reasonable. We also enjoyed the bar in the lobby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds!”
Reviews.Author: patit
Reviews.Content: Good Service. Nice room with good flatscreen TV. Comfy chair, decent view. Convenient location to the convention center. But the bed was the prize. It was so comfy!

Reviews.Title: “updated rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Happy1950
Reviews.Content: Hotel changed hands on Dec 31, 2011 so it is newly rennovated with new administration as Marriott. We had room on 15th floor and could see the gorgeous sunrises reflected on the cityscape. The room was large and very clean. Only weakness was no safe or refrigerator. Perhaps to be installed later? Immediately outside the hotel was the metro rail system that took us to great restaurants and museums. Rode all day for $3.50-went to the Heard Museum, the Art Museum and took bus to the large Scottsdate shopping mall- all for the one day price. Well within walkingdistance to nice restaurants and pro-team athletic areas too. So simple to follow directions and the concierge made it all easywith maps. All personnel at the hotel were so friendly and asked us repeatedly if they could help us. We will definitely stay there again. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Floyd the doorman is the best”
Reviews.Author: Cat B
Reviews.Content: Every time you enter or leave this hotel, you will pass Floyd, who is wonderfully good-natured, alert, genuinely interested in each individual, caring, and has a wonderful sense of humor. Inside the hotel, which had changed hands from Wyndham to Renaissance only month before I stayed, the rooms are very nice, spacious, and beds are exceptionally comfortable. I spend about 100 nights a year in hotel rooms, so am used to restless nights in hotel rooms, but for the five nights I was here, I slept like a log every night - and that made me hate to leave. Shower has excellent water pressure. The hotel is within a few blocks of lots of interesting restaurants as well as the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: it's an older hotel, but they clearly have rececently updated the rooms which are somewhat small but very nice. Free wifi is good and strong, a friendly staff and a good downtown location make this a solid downtown Phoenix option. I heard the hotel had a ownership change during my stay, I believe it is now a JW Marriott.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Phoenix Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 50 East Adams Street, Phoenix, AZ 85004
